headline: Baker Hughes (BKR) Margin Gains Reinforce Bullish Narratives Despite Slower Earnings Growth
summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) capped the year with earnings growth of 29.1% and a net profit margin that improved to 10.4% from 8.2%. Over the last five years, annual earnings growth has averaged a remarkable 81.2% as the company solidified its shift to profitability. For investors, this consistent margin expansion paired with ongoing revenue growth and a lack of notable risk flags paints a compelling picture heading into the next fiscal period. headline: Basin rig count down one as prices jump
summary: The rig count in the Permian Basin was down one this week, the latest count Friday by Baker Hughes shows, with 250 rigs active in the region. A year ago, 304 rigs were active in the region. Nationally, the oil and gas rig count is up two from last week at 550 rigs. A year ago, 585 rigs were active. The count shows that 420 rigs sought oil, up two from the previous week, and 121 explored for ...
